intro: Lobelia baumannii f. alba, commonly known as white lobelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
